comments.body: Willow or cotton wood would be a little addition to add in the swamp biome; since there is no way of getting these trees in vanilla but mods...
or maybe just make any oak trees that grow in swamps be the swamp tree shape by default, instead of the normal tree shape

I agree that Swamps need updating. Adding a new tree here would definitely help. The planks could look like jungle wood planks but with a slight green tinge. The leaves could be like the Spruce Leaves that don't change colour and stay brown all the time. With the addition of this new wood type means a new Door, Trapdoor, Button, Pressure Plate, Fence, Fence Gate, and IDEALY Bookshelf and Chest. Would be great if this was added.
Cotton could be used to make armor or a wool substitute.
I think its nice but..with not much Ores is this borring but nice ideaüëç
Nah I'm fine with it being the way it is now. You only need it for decoration anyway.
whats the point...I mean that's a cool idea but there's no need
Spider webs aren't only decorative, and maybe they would be used more if they were able to be crafted.

@ClayGoddessSari What other uses are there, other than traps and decoration? It's not a good long-term source of string or wool, if that's what you are thinking of. Mineshafts are not super rare, and when you do find even a single one, you're almost guaranteed to find a couple hundred cobwebs at the minimum, which is plenty for all but the wildest builds. I repeat, there is no need for a crafting recipe.

I don't think there should be a crafting recipe, but it would be cool if you could somehow get more of them then the amount that generates in your world. Perhaps spiders very rarely drop them, or place them as a way to slow you down. Or they just appear in abondoned builds.
I support cobweb being crafted with 9 string

There is something to be said about leaving Coral a rare block that can't be replenished.  It shows how fragile these eco systems are.

 

However, I really like this idea for two reasons:

1) It gives Redstoners something fun to do.

2) Coral is still a limited resource.  The machine turns fans and coral plants into coral blocks.  It doesn't replenish them.  So the Redstone idea certainly doubles the Coral you can obtain, but after a while you'll run out of fans and plants.
I think is too complicated.Using bonemeal to grow them is what I hope.And it is the feature of Minecraft,right?

coral/coral fans (that are exposed to water) could grow (slowly, but naturally) if adjacent to a solid block (other than the block it is attached to) (stone or it's variants as well as iron, gold, or copper [and their raw variants] and finally other coral blocks)

*Block   Coral fan

Block     *Block

This way you can grow coral. However, some kind of activities done by players and drowned should be able to harm the coral reefs (ie, too many drowned mobs?)

If the end update was to happen I don't want a new ore to be called enderite as it feels like a copy and paste form of netherite which we already have. Why not name it to like venorium. Which sounds like a more unique name rather than enderite.
I like it, but it's on a fanon Minecraft wiki called "Minecraft fanon wiki", yes I am correct.
I hope it doesn't turn into spam.

"Minecraft has a lot of blocks, but what if they had more? Why do we need them? Please don't just add lists of things - these will be marked as spam and removed! Also, no furniture, guns, or vertical/"sideways"/"upright"/"standing" slabs (yes, we see you)." -Mojang
I hope this happens. They have only added 1 end update. But they added nether forests and ores. Why not the end?
Ya know what? Ima make this an addon.

I love this idea!,

I would like new elytra's or new transportation, enderite, wood in the end, stone in the end, grappling hook, biomes in the end, end iron, new shield variants, new armour, new weapons, new tools, new items, new pets and new bosses.

I would love enderite sets of armor and tools, new end biomes, mobs, end enchanted apples, and new structures, and new projectiles. these things have been added in mods but it would be amazing in vanilla.
you know what would be even better? Respawn anchors working in the end so we can make an actual base there.
Fantastic idea and wouldn‚Äôt even take much coding since they can just use the temperature system in game. Just up the temp of the End to Snowy Tundra levels, and boom. Done.
or you can use the stone grinder t create 4 blocks of sand of 1 cobble stone e
411526248252 I like that idea a lot.

We definitely need a way to make sand renewable. This is especially needed on bedrock where TNT dupers aren't able to be made, so you have a much smaller availability of sand for large scale uses of TNT such as building perimeters for efficient farms. I've seen suggestions from videos to have the Husk drop sand which could be pretty interesting. I don't think dropping an anvil onto blocks is a very practical way to make sand due to the large amount of iron involved and how quickly anvils break.

Since sand has a lot of silica in it, and quartz is a silicon crystal - What if you could crush quartz to sand and amethyst shards to red sand? Both quartz and amethyst shards are renewable (block of quartz can be bought from stonecutter and amethyst shards can be grown).

W a n d e r i n g   t r a d e r

But serioulsy, we need this

I hate tearing down desserts leaving a hideous landscape behind so I fully agree. Here are my top ideas of how to implement this: 
1. HUSKS drop dust, that can be crafted into sand blocks (maybe 2x2 crafting like honey)
2. GRAVEL can be processed into sand for example by running flowing water over it, or dropping it onto copper grates/ sifting it
3. the TRIAL VAULTs give you sand when you open them more than once (that would also solve the problem of overflow keys if you enjoy fighting the trial chambers a lot, but cant expand your world any more)
4. some new mechanics with STONE were by processing it you get dust that can be crafted into sand. There are many options of how to do that, but I think the other 2 options are better


Or at least make deserts have deeper sand layers

I see everyone's comments and ideas for how to make renewable sand. For the most part they are good.

I did some researching and yes, sand has quartz (silica) in it, but it also has feldspar¬π which contains Potassium and Calcium. Yellow sand also known as beach sand, also contains some elements of iron oxide, which gives it different hues of color.

So I propse the crafting recipe be:
One iron ingot - representing Iron Oxide.
One of either potato or poisonous potato - representing Potassium.
One bonemeal - representing calcium.
And one Nether Quartz - representing the Silica.
Too OP sorry mate but I don‚Äôt like this idea, no hate I just disagree with you
I think it's an awesome idea, but why gold? Anyway I love it and everything you do, keep up the good work!
I really think this is a good idea as the players who aren‚Äôt so good at the game and can‚Äôt get their hands on shulker boxes or ender chests can still have something with the same effect
It may just naturally repel ghast fireballs. If there are different levels, the first level could just repel the arrows and the second level could repel them back at the mob who shot it
you can't repel ghast fireballs, they just explode. But it is still a good idea for arrows.

A recovery enchantment might work, basically it decreases shield recovery time after taking a very heavy hit.

Another that might work is Barrier, which increases the area the shield protects.

Community votes dependant or not on the Minecraft Live could be use for community members to submit ideas that would be picked to be put in-game. Twitter and reddit are great platforms for submissions. This would be a fantastic way to embrace the players
Maybe there could be a new painting each time there is a special event.
Music Discs were something that needed updates and I think something that could use updates too is paintings in fact I was going to suggest this same idea but then I found this post.
Great idea. How would you craft the lights?

There shouldn't even need to be an additional recipe to have coloured light from some preexisting source blocks that already have clear distinct colours.

Redstone torches should produce red light primarily and frog lights should have an equivalent tint to them.
This absolutely needs to be a thing

If a skeleton sinks into it, it can become a parched skeleton mob.
On this note, can we have more dye colors?
This just makes sense. It's not like this would make it harder to collect than other dyes.

I'm not very keen on removing the old crafting recipe, but I think it would be fine if both crafting recipes produced lime dye. Either way, adding mint green dye would be interesting, but I feel it would be somewhat out of place.
tbh having to combine green and yellow to make lime dye will make more sense as minecraft translates lime dye to  ÈªÑÁªøËâ≤ÊüìÊñô  in mandarin, which literally means ''yellow green dye''.

I like having large variety of customizations so it would be very cool if we can have like concrete or wooden paintable doors with different designs just like leather armor. Give that post a like (the original post not my comment) so we can see more of those in the game!
Paned glass doors/trapdoors, copper and gold doors/trapdoors, etc., would be excellent.

Alongside this, i think that adding the ability to put certail items into armor slots, an example would be the pillagers and how they have a chance of spawning with a Illager banner on their head, it would be cool if you could do this as well, taking a banner and putting it in the helmet slot, or perhaps a shulker box in the chesplate slote for more carrying capacity, having more equippables with special functions would be a blast.

Using a bucket on a honey comb wouldn't make sense because if you can only fill a bottle with honey from a nest or hive, how will a honey comb fill a bucket. I think that you should have to fill the cauldron with honey using honey bottles to get a bucket of honey, which gives the cauldron a use.
I want to be able to move iron golems in the nether from one place to another.  A flowing river of honey would do the trick--even if it's as slow as...honey.

Agreed. As an addition, what if arrows and other projectiles got stuck in cobwebs? Would be neat if you could erect a wall of cobwebs to just block all incoming arrow fire. Ooh! That gave me another idea! What if Flame Arrows burned through cobwebs and leaves?
In reality, arrows contain so much kinetic energy that they would go right through cobwebs, but I like the idea of flame arrows burning them.
DarkComet742, that sounds really cool! Both ideas sound great!
i also agree, flame arrows should set ignitable things on fire and the arrows that do go through the leaves and cobwebs should be thin arrows that should go faster but take up more items.
